distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for sqlite3 fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed: 

- CVE-2018-20346: Fixed a remote code execution vulnerability in FTS3 (Magellan) (bsc#1119687).
- CVE-2018-20506: Fixed an integer overflow when FTS3 extension is enabled (bsc#1131576).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

full_product_name.name: libsqlite3-0-3.8.10.2-9.3.1.x86_64 as component of SUSE Enterprise Storage 4
libsqlite3-0-32bit-3.8.10.2-9.3.1.x86_64 as component of SUSE Enterprise Storage 4
sqlite3-3.8.10.2-9.3.1.x86_64 as component of SUSE Enterprise Storage 4

notes.text: SQLite before 3.25.3, when the FTS3 extension is enabled, encounters an integer overflow (and resultant buffer overflow) for FTS3 queries that occur after crafted changes to FTS3 shadow tables, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging the ability to run arbitrary SQL statements (such as in certain WebSQL use cases), aka Magellan.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: SQLite before 3.25.3, when the FTS3 extension is enabled, encounters an integer overflow (and resultant buffer overflow) for FTS3 queries in a "merge" operation that occurs after crafted changes to FTS3 shadow tables, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging the ability to run arbitrary SQL statements (such as in certain WebSQL use cases). This is a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-20346.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
